p: Sea fennel is used for several culinary uses also for its fennel-like aromatic traits [ 2]. Thus, it is interesting to compare the proximate composition of sea fennel with that of common fennel ( Foeniculum vulgare L.). Sea fennel shows a lower water content and a higher total lipid and protein content with respect to common fennel ( Table 1). Total carbohydrate content seem to be the same for both species, nevertheless, see fennel shows a very low content of sugar and a relatively higher content of fiber with respect to common fennel ( Table 1).
